title: La Camelina Linear Park
description: A serene green corridor filled with crystal-clear waterfalls, scenic viewpoints, and peaceful walking paths. Locals come here to unwind, listen to birdsong, and enjoy the soothing rhythm of nature. It’s a hidden gem perfect for quiet reflection or a family picnic.

title: Casa más Angosta del Mundo
description: Step inside one of the quirkiest landmarks in Mexico — the narrowest house in the world. Despite its tiny footprint, this space is cleverly designed and full of charm. A short but memorable visit that sparks curiosity and conversation.

title: Artisan Market of Uruapan
description: Located near the national park, this open-air market showcases Michoacán’s finest crafts: lacquerware, textiles, wood carvings, and pottery. With over 100 stalls, it’s a vibrant celebration of local talent and a perfect spot to find one-of-a-kind souvenirs.
